title: DS220.15 Application Workflow & Access Patterns | Data Modeling with Apache Cassandra
description:
#DataStaxAcademy #DS220
DS220.15 Application Workflow & Access Patterns
We need to figure out how users are going to navigate through our application. We call this the application workflow. This is necessary so we know which queries to perform against our Apache Cassandra database. Learn more about the application workflow in this unit.

LEARN FOR FREE at https://academy.datastax.com -- access all the FREE complete courses, tutorials, and hands-on exercises.

ASK QUESTIONS at https://community.datastax.com -- where experts from DataStax & the Apache Cassandra community share their expertise everyday.

transcript.text: [Music] now that we have our conceptual data model we need to figure out how users will navigate through our application we call this the application workflow this is necessary so that we can determine which queries will perform against our apache cassandra database remember apache cassandra is query driven instead of worrying about just what objects are in our data model we need to figure out the queries early in the process now you may be thinking jamie this isn't very flexible it's fine if you need to add queries later go ahead and do so and then follow the rest of the process to build the fundamental table at the physical layer if you think about it every application has a workflow for example a user will log into a website what do they do after they've logged into the website where are they going to click what data are they going to commit what data are they going to read that's just how users navigate a website application every application has this workflow and that's what an application workflow diagram is let's take that example and see if we can develop it further here we have query one the user comes into killer video and they want to log into the website so look at the access pattern there at the bottom of the slide we need to find a user with a specific email once a user is logged into the site they can go see the latest videos at killer video notice that we don't actually have to log into the site to see the latest videos that'd be kind of weird to have a video sharing website where the first thing you had to do is log in we want users to be able to easily access our videos so they could either get there by logging in or they could just come visit the website either way we have query 2. look at the query at the bottom find the most recently uploaded videos i don't know about you but when i visit video sharing websites i want to see the latest cool stuff if a user does log into our site they can see the basic information about their user account or other user accounts but the only way they can actually get to this part of the website is by logging in thus we have an arrow leading us from user logging into the website down into looking at information about themselves or other users when a user wants to see profile information about other users we look up those users by their id now this may be a little bit creepy but if a user wants to lurk or stock through other users uploaded videos they can do so as well after logging into the killer video website that gives us query four look at the bottom here find videos uploaded by a user with a known id we have an extra requirement here saying show most recently uploaded videos first here is query five show a video and its details when a user comes to killer video they get a whole list of available videos they can further click on that video and see all the details about that video that's what query 5 is doing for us thus for query 5 we need to find a video with a specific video id like the last exercise we have a partially completed application workflow for you we're going to leave it up to you to fill in the rest of the details
